description.narrative: Emergency project in Greater Pibor Administration Area (GPAA) for 6 months involves distribution of emergency food and agriculture inputs for 6 months (3 cycles of food).  The number of households (HH) is 1,000 in Pibor.

title.narrative: ACC-I1 - Number of crisis-affected people who are also involved in the design, implementation, monitoring and/or evaluation of the programme

description.narrative: Based on experience of previous distributions, ZOA will involve men and women to be involved in the implementation and particularly the monitoring and evaluation of the programme

comment.narrative:
ZOA collaborated with JAM, WFP implementing partner in Bor South as the project targeted the same location but their project had ended. JAM shared and we inherited their database and this greatly saved us time for mobilization and registration. They also introduced ZOA to established structures such as the PCMs. These were already trained and versed with the humanitarian work which saved money and time in identifying and capacity building. This collaboration also assured us of synergies as beneficiaries recommended by JAM would transition to their future project as they were drawn from their database.
During the distribution exercise, ZOA worked in collaboration with RRC (Relief and Rehabilitation Commission) representatives at State, County and Payam levels, local chiefs and community members (commonly referred to as Project Management Committees PMCs). - The RRC represented government to ensure the food aid is delivered to the right communities and beneficiaries. They also stepped in to address any issue that requires the government intervention, - The PMCs were tasked to oversee the distribution process and assist in educating the community about the project. The local leaders (Chiefs) supported ZOA during the physical verification of the beneficiaries. More especially during cases of misplaced identification card/token.
Number of crisis-affected people who are also involved in the design, implementation, monitoring and/or evaluation of the programme - A total 300 beneficiaries majority women n=290 (97%) were involved in the project design in different ways such as being respondents during the PDM and feedback, loaders and off-leaders and facilitating distribution as casual workers.

title.narrative: ACC-I2 - Number of adaptations in the design and/or implementation of the JR, as a result of the input from beneficiaries.

description.narrative: Input from beneficiaries in a current food distribution project that ZOA is carrying out in the same region (Gumuruk) has been incorporated into the design of this project

comment.narrative: ZOA liased with the JR lead on the needs of the beneficiaries in Pibor. As a NCE request, to support these beneficiares when roads are accessible again, was declined, it was planned that under the PCM JR 2022 the needs of these beneficairies will be considered to be addressed. As ZOA is not part of the PCM JR in South Sudan, we are not aware if these beneficairies have been included in the target groups for 2022.

title.narrative: FSC-I1 - Number of people provided with resources to protect and start rebuilding livelihood assets

description.narrative: Distribution of seeds, agricultural tools and fishing gear to 1000 HHs. This will be done as one off distribution, divided over multiple days / locations to prevent spreading of Covid19. The timing will be before the beginning of the rainy season, so Mid-May or earlier

comment.narrative: More beneficiaries (2000 HHs) reached than planned (1000 HHs). The FSL Cluster advised to reach out the IDPs especially with the vegetable kits to enable HH displaced by the floods access vegetable to improve their diet.

description.narrative: Distribution of food parcels (as per Logistics Cluster guidelines) to 1000 HHs. Three months coverage (one distribution per month). Timing will be as soon as possible. Distributions will be divided over multiple distribution days / locations, to prevent spreading of Covid-19

comment.narrative: More beneficiaries (1500 HHs) reached than planned (1000 HHs).
